My email: changrui.mu@u.nus.edu

Hi! I'm Changrui. I am fortunately working as the research assistant at NUS with Dr. Prashant Nalini Vasudevan.
My research interest lies in, cryptography, theoretical computer science, and computer security in general. I believe that good theoretical research guides practice, and applications improve lives and security. Dynamic alignment between them benefits society.

Reseach and Teaching Experience

I was fortunate to be supervised by Dr. Prashant Nalini Vasudevan in my undergraduate final year project, and our research continued focusing on Interactive Proofs for the past two years. In the summer of 2023, I had the honor of being hosted by Dr. Ron D. Rothblum at Technion as visting student researcher, focusing on Statistical Zero Knowledge Proofs.
In addition to my research endeavors, I have a passion for teaching and disseminating knowledge. I serve as the lead Teaching Assistant for CS3235 Computer Security under the guidance of Dr. Reza Shokri and for CS4236 Cryptography Theory and Practice instructed by Dr. Prashant Nalini Vasudevan.
